intro: Guatteria herrerana, commonly known as the Herrerana guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Marcaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, and it has dark green, leathery leaves. It is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-rich soils. Guatteria herrerana is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
